Noam Chomsky is a linguist who dedicated his life to learning about language. He is known as the father of modern linguistics. But Chomsky is criticized by many for his theories of language the same way Galileo was criticized for the theory of heliocentrism. Although his linguistic theories are not easy to grasp, is Chomsky right after all? How will he be remembered in history? Many people already consider him the intellectual of the modern era. Is Chomsky another Galileo in the making?
